business.headline: Wall Street sinks amid Trump's tariff hike on Canadian metalsThe US stock market tumbled further after Trump doubled tariffs on Canadian steel and aluminum, with the Dow plunging 554 points amid rising economic uncertainty and fears of a prolonged trade war.

US stock market: Wall Street indices remain under pressure amid slowdown fearsAt the opening bell, the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 73.8 points, or 0.18%, to 41,837.95. The S&P 500 lost 10.9 points, or 0.19%, to 5,603.65, while the Nasdaq Composite was the only major index that recovered slightly in early trade.

Donald Trump to meet CEOs of America's biggest firms after Wall Street crashPresident Donald Trump is expected to speak with around 100 CEOs at a regular meeting of the Business Roundtable in Washington, an influential group of CEOs leading major US companies from Apple to JPMorgan Chase and Walmart.

Looking for fixed deposit with up to 9% interest? Check these small finance banksUnity Small Finance Bank offers 9% per annum for a 1001-day fixed deposit and 7.85% per annum for a one-year fixed deposit.

Why did Elon Musk's wealth shrink by $29 billion in a single day? Tesla's struggles have had a major impact on Musk's financial losses. In the past two months, Tesla's stock has fallen by 35%,wiping out $400 billion in market value.
Airtel signs deal with Elon Musk's SpaceX to bring Starlink internet to IndiaThe deal depends on SpaceX getting approval from authorities to sell Starlink services in India.
Sensex ends marginally lower, Nifty in green; IndusInd Bank crashes 27%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 12.85 points to end at 74,102.32, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 37.60 points to close at 22,497.90.

UPI and RuPay merchant charges may return: What it means for youThe government is planning to introduce a tiered pricing system, where bigger businesses pay higher charges while small businesses pay reduced charges.

Elon Musk says balancing DOGE and CEO roles is tough as Tesla shares slideElon Musk has been actively involved in Tesla, SpaceX, X (formerly Twitter), and xAI, along with his inclination to working with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).

IndusInd Bank share price crashes 27%: Buy, hold or sell?IndusInd Bank stock price: At the closing bell, IndusInd Bank shares were down 27.17% to Rs 655.95 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), marking their worst trading session ever.
DA hike: How much can central government employees expect?The expected hike is likely to benefit around 12 million central government employees and pensioners under the 7th Pay Commission.

US stock market crash: Why Sensex, Nifty aren't feeling the heatThe S&P BSE Sensex was down less than 170 points at around 11:35 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fluctuated between gains and losses. The 50-share index was down barely 20 points but showed no signs of panic. Broader market indices also stayed flat as volatility spiked.

Skipped filing ITR? You may get a tax notice very soonThe tax authorities use a risk management strategy (RMS) to flag high-risk non-filers, said the department.  This system looks at high-value transactions (property purchases, large bank deposits, etc.), income from salary, rent, mutual funds, and shares, etc.

IndusInd Bank share crash: Should you buy as stock falls 22% today?The decline in IndusInd Bank share price came after the bank, in an internal review of its derivative portfolio, found discrepancies that could reduce its net worth by an estimated 2.35%. This amounts to an impact of nearly Rs 1,577 crore.

Sensex down nearly 400 points: Why is the stock market falling today? The Sensex fell nearly 400 points, while the Nifty dropped over 100 points as investors reacted to growing concerns about a possible recession in the US, along with a sharp fall in IT stocks.

Sensex, Nifty eye shaky opening as Wall Street crash spooks global marketsUS stock markets saw their biggest single-day fall since 2022 on Monday, March 10. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq crashed by up to 4%, while the Dow Jones dropped 2.08%.

IndusInd Bank shares in focus after Rs 1,577 crore networth hit riskThe stock fell nearly 4% to Rs 900.50 on the NSE in the previous session. IndusInd Bank's stock has lost more than 37% in the past six months, with a 16% decline in the last four weeks alone.

Tesla shares tumble almost 16% as US stock markets crashTesla shares plunged 15.4 per cent to USD 222.15 on Monday, their lowest since October, amid investor pessimism over slumping sales and Trump administration trade policy uncertainty. It was Tesla's steepest drop since September 2020.

Trump tariffs, recession fears slam US markets, wiping out $4 trillion in valueDonald Trump's tariffs have rattled investors, wiping out USD 4 trillion from the S&P 500 as trade uncertainty with Canada, Mexico, and China grows.

US stocks fall sharply as recession fears grow; Nasdaq down 4%US stocks fell sharply as concerns over tariffs and a potential government shutdown fuelled recession fears. The S&P 500 had its worst one-day drop since December, falling 2.7%, while the Nasdaq dropped 4%, confirming a correction.

Wall Street sell-off worsens on Trump tariffs, recession worriesEuropean markets have already taken a hit, and Asian markets are unlikely to be spared. Dalal Street is likely in for a rough session on Tuesday, especially information technology (IT) stocks that rely on the US for business.

US markets open lower day after Trump declines to rule out recessionIt's not just stocks struggling. Investors are sending prices lower for all kinds of investments whose momentum had earlier seemed nearly impossible to stop at times, such as bitcoin.

Tesla shares dip 45% in 3 months: What's behind the decline?Tesla's market value has fallen 45% since reaching a record high of $1.5 trillion on December 17, 2024. The stock surge followed Musk's financial backing of Donald Trump's election victory.

7th Pay Commission: DA hike announcement this week, likely before HoliOver 12 million central government employees and retirees are likely to benefit from the said hike under the 7th Pay Commission. With this possible revision, the DA would increase from 53% to 55% of the basic pay.

EPFO announces new rules for EDLI Scheme: 3 key death benefits updatesThe EDLI scheme is part of the Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) and acts as a social security benefit, offering financial assistance to the dependents of an EPF member in the event of the untimely death of the EPF member while still employed.
Why are Tata Power shares rising today? Details here Tata Power stock has had a mixed run. The stock is down 20% in the past six months but has still gained 67% over the past two years.

entertainment.headline: Telugu actor-politician Posani Krishna Murali granted bail in all casesActor and YSRCP member Posani Krishna Murali has been granted bail in all cases. American rock band Guns N' Roses to return to India after 12 years American rock band Guns N' Roses will return to India after 12 years. They will perform in Mumbai on May 17.

All about BLA's Majeed Brigade, Fateh Squad, STOS that led Pak train hijackingThe Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) has claimed responsibility for hijacking a train in Pakistan's Bolan district, holding hundreds of passengers hostage. The BLA, which has a history dating back to post-independence, has fought several battles against the state of Pakistan. It operates through several specialised units, including Zirab, which is reportedly behind the hijacking.

Live: Baloch militants' 48-hour deadline to Pak, seek prisoners swap for train hostagesJaffar Express train hijacked live updates: A passenger train in Pakistan carrying around 500 people was hijacked by Baloch separatists in the country's restive Balochistan province on Tuesday. The Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) militants stopped the Peshawar-bound Jaffar Express in a tunnel after blowing up a track and claimed that they had taken 214 as hostages, and killed over 30 Pakistani military personnel. However, the local police disputed the BLA's claim and said that about 350 passengers were safe. The BLA, a militant separatist group seeking autonomy for the region, has also threatened to execute all hostages if security forces didn't retreat. The outfit has given a 48-hour deadline to release all political prisoners in exchange for releasing all passengers. The train, which was coming from Quetta, was attacked and efforts were being made to establish contact with the people on board, government officials said. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

MS Dhoni joins Rishabh Pant in sister's gala wedding at MussoorieTwo generations of Indian wicketkeepers Rishabh Pant and MS Dhoni are currently in Mussoorie for the former's sister's wedding. Rishabh Pant's sister Sakshi is getting married to Ankit Chaudhary.

El Clasico: Carles Puyol, Luis Figo to play Legends match in IndiaLegendary FC Barcelona captain Carles Puyol and former Real Madrid striker Luis Figo are amongst two of the big names to play the El Clasico Legends in India. The match is set to be played at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Gujarat Titans IPL 2025 Complete Schedule: Full GT Fixtures, Venues, Match DatesGujarat Titans IPL 2025 Full Schedule: After a fantastic auction, Gujarat Titans will be aiming to head back to the promise land of playoffs in IPL 2025.

WFI suspension revoked: Why the government decided to take drastic callSports minister Mansukh Mandaviya told India Today the reason why the decision was made to revoke the suspension put on the Wrestling Federation of India. The WFI's suspension was lifted on March 11.

Manchester United announce plan to build new 100,000-seater stadiumManchester United have announced plans to build a new 100,000-seater stadium next to the existing Old Trafford on Tuesday, March 11. The new stadium will be the centrepiece of the Old Trafford regeneration project by United.

No one can tell Rohit, Virat to retire, they should play till 2027: Yograj SinghFormer India cricketer Yograj Singh believes that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli should play till the 2027 World Cup. Yograj was glad that Rohit did not announce his retirement after the Champions Trophy.

Very few messaged me: Shreyas Iyer recalls tough phase before Champions TrophyChampions Trophy hero Shreyas Iyer recalled the highs and lows of the last 18 months of his cricket career. After losing the central contract with the BCCI, Shreyas led KKR to IPL success in 2024 and played a key role in India's Champions Trophy success.

Kush Maini becomes 1st Indian in F1 since 2012, joins Alpine as reserve driverKush Maini became the third Indian driver to be a part of F1 as he joined the Alpine team as a reserve driver. Maini will continue to act as a test driver for the team as well, with a view to making it to the main grid in 2026.

Social media claims Rohit Sharma forgot the trophy. Here's why we think he didn'tChampions Trophy 2025: A video of Rohit Sharma leaving the post-final press conference without taking the Champions Trophy has gone viral. Fans on social media claimed it was one of those moments when Rohit's infamous memory lapses were at play. However, here's what a closer look at the full video tells us.

Above my pay grade: Hardik Pandya when asked why India didn't play in PakistanHardik Pandya gave a witty response to a journalist who asked why India didn't travel to Pakistan during the Champions Trophy 2025. India played all their matches in Dubai during the tournament.

Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy stadium to use treated wastewater for IPL 2025As Bengaluru faces another water crisis as summer approaches, the authorities will continue supplying treated wastewater to Chinnaswamy Stadium for IPL 2025.

Hardik Pandya joins Mumbai Indians after Champions Trophy winIPL 2025: After guiding India to glory in the Champions Trophy in Dubai, Hardik Pandya has joined the Mumbai Indians (MI) and will be looking to put in some strong performances for the five-time champions.

On This Day: RCB sign Virat Kohli in IPL U-19 draft after Delhi blunderOn this day in 2008, Royal Challengers Bengaluru snapped up Virat Kohli during the IPL U-19 draft after Delhi opted not to sign their local man. Kohli has remained with RCB since the first IPL season.

RCB can play party-spoilers for Mumbai Indians. Here's howWPL 2025: The match between Mumbai Indians (MI) and Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) on Tuesday at the Brabourne Stadium would decide the finalist for the ongoing edition.

Why Indian team won't have felicitation ceremony after Champions Trophy winThe Indian team won't have a felicitation ceremony after their Champions Trophy win on Sunday, March 9 against New Zealand. The players are slowly returning home after their title win with IPL 2025 season set to start.

All England Open Badminton Championships: When and where to watch Double Olympic medallist PV Sindhu, Lakshya Sen are amongst the Indian stars to take part in the All England Open Badminton Championships 2025 to be staged from March 11 to 16 in Birmingham.

No Shakib, Mahmudullah opts out as BCB reveal 2025 central contract listShakib Al Hasan was overlooked as Mahmudullah decided to opt out of the Bangladesh Cricket Board's central contract list for 2025. Taskin Ahmed was the only player to be given the Grade A+ contract.

Some Manchester United players not 'good enough', some 'overpaid': Jim RatcliffeManchester United co-owner Jim Ratcliffe has delivered a damning verdict on the current squad, saying some of the players are not 'good enough'. Ratcliffe also gave his backing to current manager Ruben Amorim.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
